---
title: MAST vs DASI
---

## MAST vs DASI

As psychologists aiming to gather comprehensive insights into alcoholism and self-injurious behavior, we often find ourselves drawing upon two key instruments - the Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST) and the Drug, Alcohol, and Self Injury Questionnaire (DASI). Drawing comparisons between MAST and DASI is instrumental in offering nuanced perspectives and understanding the interconnectedness of the behaviors they measure. However, manual MAST vs DASI comparisons can be time-consuming and daunting. This is where Harmony, a state-of-the-art harmonization software, comes in use.

## Compare the items in MAST and DASI

Harmony is built on advanced natural language processing technologies and AI models that hugely simplify the harmonization process. It enables us to quickly and accurately match items from both MAST and DASI, rendering the entire process more objective. Harmony can provide a percentage match between individual items in both questionnaires, ensuring an efficient comparison of MAST vs DASI. It can also compare items in multiple languages for studies requiring cross-cultural comparisons.


{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare MAST and DASI " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}




Taking advantage of Harmony's impressive features allows us to optimize our research process significantly. By feeding MAST and DASI instruments into Harmony's platform, we can effortlessly get them harmonized and ready for our comparative analysis. Be it checking consistency across studies or identifying changes in response to social conditions, Harmony proves invaluable in a MAST vs DASI comparison. Hence, shifting this process to a digital platform guarantees unparalleled accuracy, saving copious amounts of time, and reduces the risk of manual errors.
